title: Wild Belle cancels Radio City gig after their dad died in horror crash with wife
text:
Siblings, Elliot and Natalie Bergman, of the Wild Belle band canceled their Radio City performance Thursday night and their appearances on a tour after their father was killed in a horrific car crash alongside his wife.

Envestnet Incorporated's CEO Judson Bergman, 62, was one of four victims killed in the San Francisco car crash that occurred early Thursday morning. His wife, 57-year-old Mary, also died in the crash after they were hit by a drunk driver.

Following news of the accident, Elliot and Natalie announced the cancellation in two tweets.

'Due to unforeseen circumstance Wild Belle will not be performing at tonight’s Radio City Music Hall show with Incubus. We’ll pass along more info regarding the rest of the tour as soon as we have it,' they shared Thursday.

Siblings, Elliot and Natalie Bergman of the Wild Belle band, canceled their show Thursday night and upcoming appearances on a tour after their father, Jud Bergman, 62, was killed in a car crash alongside his wife, Mary

Judson Bergman (left) was thrown from the taxi that was carrying him and his wife, Mary (right)

Following news of the accident, Elliot and Natalie Bergman shared their cancellations in two tweets

On Friday, the siblings followed that tweet up with an apology (above) to their fans

On Friday, the siblings followed that tweet up with an apology to their fans.

'With apologies, Wild Belle are unable to join Incubus on their current tour as planned. They’d like to thank Incubus, everyone involved with the tour, and the fans for their love and support,' the tweet reads.

The California Highway Patrol said the collision happened about 12.30am Thursday, just minutes after people started calling authorities to report a Volkswagen sedan driving south in the northbound lanes of Highway 101.

Authorities say 34-year-old Emilie Ross of Hillsborough was behind the wheel.

Ross died along with, 42-year-old Berkant Ramadan Ahmed, of San Carlos, who was driving the taxi carrying the Bergmans. Jud Bergman was thrown from the taxi, authorities said.

All lanes of northbound US 101 were closed for nearly seven hours and reopened around 7am that morning.

Envestnet, the company where Bergman was CEO, shared their condolences for the couple's family and announced the company's interim CEO in a Thursday release.

'On behalf of our Board of Directors, management team and employees, we extend our deepest sympathies to Jud and Mary's family,' the company said in a statement.

Emilie Ross (left), 34, was reportedly driving drunk at the time of the collision, authorities said. She died in the crash. Berkant Ramadan Ahmed (right), 42, of San Carlos, who was driving the taxi (right) that was carrying the Bergmans, was also killed in the crash

All lanes of northbound US 101 were closed for nearly seven hours after the crash (pictured) and reopened around 7am that morning

'As Envestnet's founder, Jud was a remarkable leader whose vision, brilliance and drive built the foundation for Envestnet's success.'

The company tapped Bill Crager as Interim Chief Executive Officer. Crager has served as Envestnet's President since 2002.

According to Envestnet, Jud Bergman founded the company in 1999 on the 'premise that technology would change the financial advisor industry'.

'As the industry evolved, Jud’s vision grew, but he was always focused on the end result for the investor, which was enhancing financial wellness and helping advisors drive better financial outcomes and improve lives,' the statement reads.

'Jud’s spirit will forever be the foundation of Envestnet.'

Bergman's networth by the end of July was an estimated $56.1million.

A GoFundMe account has been set up for Berkant Ramadan Ahmed to help his family with funeral costs.

According to the family, 'funeral plans are still being arranged, and upon his wishes he will be transported to Bulgaria and buried next to his mother'.

Ahmed, who is a father-of-one, is remembered as being a 'loving father'.
description: Elliot and Natalie Bergman of the Wild Belle band canceled their show Thursday night and upcoming appearances on a tour after their father, Jud Bergman, 62, was killed in a car crash.
